examples_used.explainer:
Use regional categories, in this case "Regionalna kategoria ugrozenosti"
Never use "Globalna kategoria ugrozenosti.
Regional categories are mentioned second, text is in croatian.

examples_used.input: Regionalna kategorija ugro`enosti: EN: B2a,b(iv),c(iii); C2a(ii)
examples_used.explainer: statusCriteria comes is mentioned after statusCodeVerbatim

full_extraction_results.notes: The regional conservation status 'RE' and criteria 'A2c' are explicitly mentioned in the text. The global status 'VU' is not used as per instructions, which require regional status only.

The text does not provide any regional conservation status or criteria for Spermophilus citellus. The mention of 'Globalna kategorija ugroženosti: VU:D2' refers to the global status, which is not to be used per instructions. No regional assessment is mentioned.

The status criteria are not provided, hence 'NF' would be expected, but the text includes a '?' instead of a clear criteria string. As per instructions, the criteria field is filled with '?' as it appears in the text, though it is not a standard IUCN criterion.
The text mentions 'Regionalna kategorija ugro~enosti: RE', but no criteria codes are provided after it. Therefore, statusCriteria is set to 'NF' as no specific criteria are listed.

The text also references legal protections (Habitats Directive, Bern Convention, CITES), but no regional status category is explicitly stated. Therefore, both statusCodeVerbatim and statusCriteria are set to 'NF'.

However, since the primary regional status is NT, it is used as the statusCodeVerbatim. The statusCriteria is taken as 'RE' as it is the only criterion explicitly mentioned in the text, though it is not standard to list RE as a criterion. project_config_used.project_description: Extracts regional conservation status for species based on standard IUCN codes.

data_fields.name: statusCodeVerbatim
data_fields.description: The REGIONAL conservation status. This is often a two-letter code. DO NOT confuse with the 'Global status'. Preferably use IUCN codes. If text mentions multiple threat assessments, extract the latest regional iucn based categories.

data_fields.name: statusCriteria
data_fields.description: The criteria codes (e.g., A2c, B1ab(iii,v), C2a(i) or C2a(ii)b or C1 and other similar iterations) used in the regional assessment. Extract them exactly as written. If none are present, return 'NF'.
